intro: Dizygotheca leptophylla, commonly known as the slender-leafed legume, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in disturbed soils or open habitats. Its growth habit is herbaceous, with stems that can become woody over time. Dizygotheca leptophylla plays a role in soil stabilization and provides forage for certain herbivores in its native ecosystems.
